channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge sides with Trump: anyone in US illegally must register with fed government
item.description: A federal judge ruled on Thursday that anyone in the U.S. illegally must register with the federal government by providing their fingerprints and addr...

item.title: Los Angeles schools block Homeland Security employees from checking on migrant children
item.description: Los Angeles schools said Thursday that they turned away two teams of Homeland Security employees that tried to enter elementary schools looking to che...

item.title: Supreme Court orders Trump administration to do its part to bring immigrant back from El Salvador
item.description: The Supreme Court on Thursday ordered Homeland Security to try to bring back an MS-13 gang suspect who was wrongly deported to El Salvador.

item.title: Trump signs bill loosening cryptocurrency regulations

item.title: Judge won't block Trump's registration requirement for immigrants

item.title: Trump announces picks for ambassadorships to combat antisemitism and promote religious freedom
item.description: President Donald Trump announced a series of nominations and appointments, including one to combat antisemitism, in a series of posts on Truth Social ...

item.title: General who helped Trump decimate ISIS terrorists in first term confirmed as Joint Chiefs chairman
item.description: Air Force Lt. Gen. Dan Caine was confirmed by the Senate as President Donald Trump's chairman of the Joint Chiefs and top military advisor.

item.title: Trump threatens tariffs and sanctions on Mexico for 'stealing' water from Texas farmers
item.description: President Trump said in a social media post that he would impose tariffs and sanctions on Mexico if it does not comply with a treaty from 1944 to prov...

item.title: Babydog Justice makes Energy Committee debut as Sen Jim Justice talks Trump, coal and grid reform
item.description: Sen. Jim Justice backed Trump’s latest energy executive order during a Senate hearing — while Babydog charmed lawmakers and reminded them to smile.

item.title: 208 Democrats Vote Against Legislation To Keep Noncitizens Out Of Elections

item.title: House Budget Hawks Are Right to Resist the Irresponsible Senate Plan
item.description: If Senate Republicans can’t commit to spending cuts in a blueprint, when will they?

item.title: Why Is Trump’s DOJ Hiding An FBI Informant’s Deposition On The Oklahoma Bombing?
item.description: An attorney in Utah is working to unearth the truth through his ongoing lawsuit for surveillance footage of the Oklahoma City bombing.

item.title: Look At Beef To Understand Why U.S. Trade Needs A Makeover
item.description: The imbalance within this industry illustrates the broader trade issues that leave the U.S. at a disadvantage.

item.title: Jimmy Lai, the Face of China’s Repression, to Receive the Bradley Prize
item.description: Lai’s story of suffering for freedom has, ironically, drawn the world’s attention to the very oppression the CCP tries so mightily to cover up.

item.title: States advance fetal rights measures that critics warn will pave a path for outlawing abortions

item.title: Today In Republicans Being Useless: GOP Senators Salvage Democrats’ ‘Green’ Energy Bailouts
item.description: Four GOP senators want a final reconciliation package to forgo 'full-scale' cuts of tax credits for so-called 'renewable energy sources.'

item.title: Trump’s True Mandate from Voters: Make Life Easier
item.description: Showerheads and gas stoves may seem like small beer, but there’s a lot to be said for making people happy.

item.title: Libraries Take a Hit in the Latest White House Order
item.description: A department supporting literacy, archive digitization, and conservation is set to sink into the briny deep.

item.title: Congress Must Assert Itself on Tariffs
item.description: My bill would require Congress to approve any presidential proposal to impose tariffs before they are put into effect.
